At the time of publication, MATIC was changing hands at $0.92, up 3.94% in the last 24 hours. Banque SYZ (Bank Syz), a prominent Swiss private bank with $30 billion in AuM, has announced the introduction of its “Syz Crypto” product, via which the Geneva-based company will provide its Swiss and foreign clients with digital asset services, including as trading and custody. According to a formal press statement released on Monday, Bank Syz will support Polygon (MATIC) and a few other cryptocurrencies at the beginning of the service. To create LGND Music, a Web3 music platform, Polygon, Warner Music Group, and e-commerce and interactive platform builder LGND have formed a multiyear partnership. When it launches in January 2023, LGND Music is intended to be a platform for music and collectibles that enables “digital collectibles from any blockchain in a proprietary player,” thereby making it possible for users to play their digital collectibles on the go.

item.content:encoded:
A US court has instructed the bankrupt cryptocurrency company Celsius to refund its customers $44 million in crypto assets.

The crypto lender, which declared bankruptcy in July 2022, has been ordered by Chief Bankruptcy Judge Martin Glenn to return millions of dollars in cryptocurrency to its customers. The company has been ordered to refund its users $44 in crypto assets in September.

Judge Glenn reportedly stated during the ruling, “I want this case to move forward.” ” I want creditors to recover as much as they possibly can as soon as they possibly can.”

In other news, the company has successfully petitioned the court to extend its exclusivity period until February 15, 2023, giving it the exclusive right to submit company reorganization plans under Chapter 11 guidelines.

The Celsius team announced its liabilities were between $1 billion and $10 billion at the time of bankruptcy filing, with over 100,000 creditors.

According to one report, Celsius had over $200 million in escrow. However, the majority of these funds (approximately $200,000) were reportedly transferred from interest-bearing to escrow accounts shortly before the bankruptcy filing. This could have given them the option to claim ownership of the funds in the custody accounts under the preferential transfer rules.

However, the court order now requires that funds held in escrow accounts be returned to customers, even if they did not enter the company’s interest-bearing accounts. Celsius advisors and stakeholders determined that the funds held in the custody accounts belonged to the customers, not Celsius, and obtained the court order.

Even after Celsius declared bankruptcy, there has been considerable uncertainty about the funds held by the company. Several high-level executives have been accused of focusing on themselves rather than the community. These allegations have primarily targeted ex-CEO Alex Mashinsky. He withdrew $10 million from the platform, according to reports in early October. Celsius immediately froze all user accounts and transactions while claiming that user funds were safe. A few days after this news broke, two other top executives were accused of stealing user funds.

Former CSO Daniel Leon and CTO Nuke Goldstein allegedly withdrew $56 million with Mashinsky shortly before the company declared bankruptcy. The fact that all three top executives put their interests ahead of the community has been a source of contention for the community, leading to a general feeling of ill will, particularly toward the disgraced former CEO himself.

item.content:encoded:
The next hard fork, dubbed “Shanghai,” will allow users to withdraw ether staked with network validators in March 2023, according to Ethereum developers.

In a session held, core developers established a rough timeline for when the Shanghai upgrade should be completed. Shanghai, also known as “Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) 4895,” is a planned upgrade that will enable validator staking withdrawals, which are currently unavailable on the network.

Users cannot withdraw staked funds from the Ethereum blockchain at this time. Shanghai would address this issue while also providing greater flexibility and convenience to those who staked ether on the network before The Merge, the last upgrade in which Ethereum switched to proof-of-stake consensus.

Due to potential technical difficulties or other unforeseen issues, there is no guarantee that the proposed timeline will be met.

Pooja Ranjan, a project manager at Ethereum Cat Herders who was present at the meeting said:

“Withdrawals will be enabled with Shanghai currently planned in March on the mainnet, if everything goes as planned.”

Developers also discussed a second hard fork, scheduled for sometime after Shanghai in the third quarter of 2023, which will introduce “proto-danksharding,” or EIP 4844, an upgrade that will increase the network’s capacity to handle more transactions.

EIP 4844 will introduce a new type of transaction format to Ethereum called “shard blob transactions,” which will allow Ethereum nodes to temporarily store and access off-chain data to address the scaling needs of blockchain apps.

Also, quite often there is a question about the legality of this industry and its reliability on the market. item.content:encoded:
Microsoft’s security division has investigated an attack in which a malicious actor targeted various cryptocurrency investment firms.

The threat actor, identified as DEV-013, was able to infiltrate chat groups on the popular messaging app Telegram and pose as a representative of a cryptocurrency investment firm. They pretended to talk about trading fees with VIP clients of major exchanges. The hacker had extensive knowledge of the subject, which made it easier for them to gain the trust of their victim.

They intended to dupe cryptocurrency investment funds into downloading an Excel file. While the document contains accurate information about the fee structures of major cryptocurrency exchanges, it also contains a malicious macro that executes another Excel sheet in the background. This allows the bad actor to gain remote access to the infected system of the victim.

Microsoft’s findings also imply that there may be other campaigns targeting crypto companies that use the same techniques. According to the tech titan, the cryptocurrency industry is “a field of interest” for cybercriminals. They can target both large and small businesses. Microsoft advises taking additional precautionary measures to avoid such attacks.

This August, cybersecurity company Check Point Software Technologies discovered a cryptocurrency mining malware campaign that had infected over 111,000 users. Microsoft and the world’s largest chipmaker Intel announced a partnership last April to prevent malicious crypto mining.

item.content:encoded:
An independent global auditor has confirmed that all the Bitcoin currently circulating on Binance, the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange, is fully accounted for.

The audit enables any exchange user to confirm the security of their Bitcoin balance using on-chain data.

Binance’s bitcoin was 101% collateralized as of November 22nd, according to the auditing service Mazars Veritas. That is, it has slightly more bitcoin than its liabilities/customer assets), which total 575,742 BTC.

The figure is consistent with Binance’s initial reveal of its proof of reserves last month when it reported net Bitcoin assets of 582,485 BTC. Such bitcoin can be found on the native Bitcoin blockchain, as well as on Ethereum, BNB Chain, and Binance Smart Chain.

After the collapse of FTX, which made the crypto community wary of crypto exchanges lending out customer deposits, proof of reserves has grown in popularity. Sam Bankman-Fried, the former CEO of the defunct exchange, has now confirmed that customers were effectively trading fake Bitcoin on the platform.

Merkle-tree proofs are designed to provide blockchain-based proof that user assets have not been tampered with. Mazars’ auditing page includes a tool that allows users to check their on-chain balance by pasting their Merkle hash from Binance.

However, as Kraken CEO Jesse Powell argued last month, Merkle Tree proofs are insufficient to prove an exchange’s solvency because they provide no information about the liabilities of a given firm. As a result, the tool must be used in conjunction with a professional audit of those debts to ensure the entity’s financial health.

Soon after FTX’s bankruptcy, Kraken issued its Proof of Reserves (alongside its Proof of Liabilities), allowing users to confirm that their accounts had been audited.

Tether, the company that created the world’s largest stablecoin, has announced the launch of an offshore Chinese Yuan-backed stablecoin.

The new stablecoin, Tether Introduces CNHT, a Stablecoin Pegged to the Chinese Yuan, brings together two of the world’s largest economies and allows users to transact with the Chinese Yuan (CNH) in a secure, digital form.

Tether continues to expand its suite of digital stablecoins, which includes the USDT, EURT, and MXNT, with the launch of CNHT; all of which aim to enable the global economy to move value quickly, securely, and cost-effectively.

CNHT is intended to be a digital representation of the Chinese Yuan, and it is backed 1:1 by the reserve currency. Tether’s partner, Capital Union, a leading international boutique financial institution based in the Bahamas, manages this reserve. Capital Union is also in charge of the reserve’s custody and auditing.

According to the company, one of the key benefits of Tether Introducing CNHT, a Stablecoin Pegged to the Chinese Yuan is that it enables cost-effective and secure Chinese Yuan transactions and eliminates the need to pay large transaction fees when sending CNHT across borders, as CNHT can be sent almost instantly and without the need for middlemen.

CNHT is also fully compliant with Chinese regulations and is available on a number of exchanges, including OKEx and Huobi.

It is the first stablecoin to be launched on the Tron blockchain, and it aims to provide a more efficient and cost-effective way for people to exchange currencies.

The introduction of this new stablecoin is expected to improve liquidity and lower transaction costs for those who use it. It will also make access to the Chinese yuan and other international currencies easier for users.

item.content:encoded:
Following the team’s 3-0 extra-time loss to Morocco in the FIFA World Cup, the Spain National Football Team Fan Token (SNFT), according to data from CoinGecko, fell 42% from $0.09 per coin to $0.03 today.

Crypto sports bettors have invested their money in tokens bearing the names of their preferred teams ever since the World Cup began. Some tokens, such as the Argentine Football Association Fan Token (ARG), function similarly to DAO governance tokens by allowing owners to vote on upcoming fan events but not on the team’s strategy or roster.

Sports fan tokens are all about the game, even though the majority of tokens can fluctuate with the turbulence of the cryptocurrency market.

The price of the ARG token fell after Saudi Arabia defeated Argentina on November 23, 2022, as supporters sold their tokens. According to Coingecko, the Argentina team fan token initially traded at $8.10 per coin on November 20, 2022, but after the team’s defeat three days later, it dropped to $5.35 and has been falling ever since.

Even a victory, however, does not ensure that a token’s value will rise. Argentina defeated Australia 2–1 on December 3, 2022. The price of the ARG token was trading at $3.57 at the time, failing to surpass the highs of the previous week.

Team tokens are used for more than just the World Cup. In April, digital asset platform Socio announced a partnership with thirteen NFL teams, including the Atlanta Falcons, Baltimore Ravens, Chicago Bears, Cleveland Browns, Los Angeles Rams, and Tampa Bay Buccaneers, to create fan tokens.

The following month, Socio announced a partnership with Major League Soccer to produce fan tokens for all 26 teams.
